item.title: South Korea Calls For ‘Mutually Beneficial’ Trade Deal With US
item.description: South Korea called for a “mutually beneficial” agreement on trade with the US during its new trade minister’s first trip to Washington this week.
item.dc:creator: Hyonhee Shin

media:content.media:description: A reach stacker unloads a container from a truck at the Port of Pyeongtaek in Pyeongtaek, South Korea, on Friday, March 14, 2025. South Korea will strengthen its scrutiny of metals imports to protect its producers from potential dumping in the local market after President Donald Trump proceeded with plans to apply 25% tariffs on global steel and aluminum imports.

item.title: Lenders Find a Fast-Growing Market in Foreign Grad Students
item.description: Some startups take a broader view of grads’ ability to repay, looking to job prospects as support for lending.
item.dc:creator: Robb Mandelbaum

item.title: California Regulator Wants to Pause Newsom Refinery Profit Cap
item.description: California’s energy market regulator is backing off a plan to place a profit cap on oil refiners in the state.
item.dc:creator: Eliyahu Kamisher, Nathan Risser

media:content.media:description: The Phillips 66 Los Angeles refinery in Wilmington, California, US, on Thursday, March 21, 2024. Phillips 66 is scheduled to release earnings figures on April 26.

item.title: Vale’s New CEO Aims to Make Brazilian Miner the World’s Biggest
item.description: The new head of Vale SA has laid out one of the Brazilian company’s biggest ambitions — becoming the world’s largest metals producer by market capitalization.
item.dc:creator: Mariana Durao

media:content.media:description: CEO of Vale SA Gustavo Pimenta

item.title: Hong Kong’s Sixfold Jump in Share Sales Drives Boom Year in Asia
item.description: Hong Kong’s having a banner year as it marches toward becoming the second-largest market globally for share sales for the first time since 2012.
item.dc:creator: Dave Sebastian, Julia Fioretti

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians walk on a street in the Central district in Hong Kong, China, on Tuesday, June 25, 2024. Four years after Hong Kong began a sweeping crackdown against political dissent, the city is struggling to meet one of its own benchmarks in reassuring foreign investors that it remains a predictable place to do business.

item.title: S&P 500 Hits Record High After $10 Trillion Rally: Markets Wrap
item.description: Wall Street traders dodged a flurry of tariff headlines to drive stocks to all-time highs, capping a week that saw a cooling in Middle East risks and signs the US economy is holding up amid subdued inflation. A rally in Treasuries stalled. The dollar advanced.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

media:content.media:description: Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly says tariffs may not lead to a large or sustained inflation surge. She also says her view remains that there could be an interest rate cut in the fall. Daly says monetary policy is in a "good place." She speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

item.title: Middle East Tensions, CBO Track Record, US Gold Card, NYC Mayoral Primary | Wall Street Week
item.description: This week, how will the United States' involvement in the Iran-Israel war affect markets and hopes for cooperation in the Middle East? And, an interview with the Director of the Congressional Budget Office on the agency's role in predicting the fiscal impact of the "Big Beautiful Bill." Plus, will President Trump’s "Gold Card" attract foreign investment to the US? Later, how Zohran Mamdani’s success in the New York City mayoral primary election tells the story of the shift within the Democratic Party and what it means for business in the city. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Stocks Head For Solid Month of Gains | The Close 6/27/2025
item.description:
Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Jeff deGraaf Renaissance Macro Sarah House Wells Fargo, Jason Goldberg Barclays, Kay Bailey Hutchison Former US Ambassador to NATO, Amanda Agati PNC, Sarah Bianchi Evercore, Vivek Mathew, Antares, Bobby Sharma, Bluestone, and Jake Danehy Fair Harbor
(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Ex-Nielsen Unit Files for US IPO That Could Target Up to $1.25 Billion
item.description: NIQ Global Intelligence Plc filed for an initial public offering, earmarking the proceeds to pare its debt load.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: NIQ helps retailers analyze consumer behavior.

item.title: Trump Says He’ll Pick a Fed Chair Who Wants to Cut Rates
item.description: President Donald Trump said he would choose a successor for Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell who wants to cut interest rates, a condition that would strike at the heart of the central bank’s independence.
item.dc:creator: Josh Wingrove

media:content.media:description: WASHINGTON, DC - JUNE 27: U.S. President Donald Trump delivers remarks as he meets with Minister of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation of Rwanda Olivier Nduhungirehe and the Foreign Minister of the Democratic Republic of the Congo Thérèse Kayikwamba Wagner in the Oval Office at the White House on June 27, 2025. The meeting took place as a peace agreement brokered by the White House, which hopes to end a conflict in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, was signed by officials of the two African nations. (Photo by Joe Raedle/Getty Images)

item.title: Trump on Canada Trade Talks: ‘We Have All the Cards’
item.description: President Donald Trump explains why he was ending all trade discussions with Canada during remarks with reporters at the Oval Office.

item.title: Billionaire Michael Dell Reaps $1.2 Billion From Stock Sale
item.description: Dell Technologies Inc. Chief Executive Officer Michael Dell sold $1.2 billion worth of shares in his namesake computer company, reducing his stake by about 3%, according to a Friday filing.
item.dc:creator: Dylan Sloan

media:content.media:description: Michael Dell, chairman and chief executive officer of Dell Inc., speaks during the Dell Technologies World conference in Las Vegas, Nevada, US, on Monday, May 20, 2024. The conference will cover AI, Multicloud, Edge, and the power of technology to change business and the world for the better.

item.title: Supreme Court Curbs Judges in Birthright Case as Trump Touts Win
item.description:
A divided SCOTUS left unresolved a fight over President Trump’s restrictions on automatic birthright citizenship.
The 6-3 ruling said Trump’s restrictions on birthright citizenship at a minimum won’t take effect for 30 days. Erik Larson explains. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: GE Vernova Is Exploring a Sale of Its Proficy Software Business
item.description: GE Vernova Inc. is exploring a potential sale of its industrial software business known as Proficy, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Liana Baker, Michelle F Davis, Josh Saul

media:content.media:description: GE Vernova Inc. signage on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Wednesday, April 23, 2025. Signs Donald Trump is rethinking the most-aggressive elements of his combative stances on trade and the Federal Reserve sent stocks to the first back-to-back gains since his tariff war escalated, while soothing volatility across asset classes.

item.title: Large US Banks Clear the Fed’s Annual Stress Test
item.description: A group of large US banks comfortably cleared the Federal Reserve’s annual stress test. The 22 banks subjected to this year’s test all remained above minimum capital levels in a hypothetical recession. Sally Bakewell has more on “Bloomberg The Close.”

item.title: Saks Gets $600 Million Lifeline as Creditors Face Steep Losses
item.description: Saks Global Enterprises has reached a $600 million debt deal with a number of its existing lenders that would force some creditors to accept losses and push them back in the repayment priority line.
item.dc:creator: Eliza Ronalds-Hannon, Reshmi Basu

media:content.media:description: A shopper carries a Saks Fifth Avenue.

item.title: Wall Street’s Booming June Is Big Bet Against Economy Doomsayers
item.description: Wall Street is throwing a summer party with markets just closing out their best cross-asset advance in more than a year on receding fears of a global trade war, igniting a buying frenzy in everything from tech funds to junk bonds.
item.dc:creator: Denitsa Tsekova, Isabelle Lee

media:content.media:description: A trader works on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: Euro Poised for Best Run Since 2017 as Dollar’s Slump Picks Up
item.description: The euro is set for its longest stretch of monthly gains in eight years, boosted by rising confidence in Europe’s economic prospects and a hunt for alternatives to the slumping dollar.
item.dc:creator: Vassilis Karamanis, Anya Andrianova, Ruth Carson

item.title: Canadian Stocks Fall as Trump Ends Trade Talks With Nation
item.description: Canada’s equities benchmark quickly dropped on Friday after US President Donald Trump said in a social media post that he was ending all trade discussions with the country, claiming that it is implementing a digital services tax.
item.dc:creator: Geoffrey Morgan, Stephanie Hughes

item.title: S&P 500 Clinches Record as Traders Shake Off Canada Levy Threat
item.description: The S&P 500 joined the Nasdaq 100 in the race to all-time highs Friday, erasing a brief dip after President Donald Trump threatened Canada with fresh tariff rates.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Semenova

media:content.media:description: Traders work at the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: Boeing Wins Buy Rating as Redburn Sees ‘Healthier’ Company
item.description: Shares of Boeing Co. are set to make gains as the company speeds up production of commercial aircraft and takes steps to move on from a series of crises in recent years, according to Rothschild & Co. Redburn.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Griffin

media:content.media:description: Boeing Co.’s manufacturing facility in Renton, Washington.

item.title: US Treasuries Post Third Week of Gains on Fed Rate-Cut Bets
item.description: US Treasuries closed out a third-straight positive week in a rally fueled by bets the Federal Reserve is ramping up to cut rates at least twice this year.
item.dc:creator: Michael Mackenzie, Greg Ritchie

media:content.media:description: The United States Department of the Treasury building in Washington DC.

item.title: Lula to Go to Top Court to Challenge Overturn of Tax Decree
item.description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s administration will appeal to Brazil’s Supreme Court to try to preserve a tax decree that Congress overturned this week, according to two government officials familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Martha Viotti Beck, Simone Iglesias, Daniel Carvalho

item.title: Platinum-Backed McGraw Hill Files for IPO Showing Narrowing Loss
item.description: Platinum Equity-backed McGraw Hill Inc. filed for an initial public offering, a sign that private equity firms are resurfacing to take more of their portfolio companies public.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians near the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Wednesday, Sept. 18, 2024. The Federal Reserve lowered its benchmark interest rate by a half percentage point Wednesday, in an aggressive start to a policy shift aimed at bolstering the US labor market. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg

item.title: Oil Steadies at End of Turbulent Week as Focus Shifts to Tariffs
item.description: Oil held steady as traders weighed the uncertain status of nuclear talks between the US and Iran against reports that OPEC+ may extend its run of super-sized production increases.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis, Julia Fanzeres

media:content.media:description: Oil storage tanks in Richmond, California. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Bruckheimer Pushes Egos Aside to Get 'F1' in Theaters
item.description: "F1: The Movie" is now in theaters with a star studded cast including Brad Pitt, Damson Idris and Kerry Condon. Produced by seven-time Academy Award winner Jerry Bruckheimer, it is looking to give the summer box office season a speedy start. Bruckheimer sat down with Bloomberg Hot Pursuit Co-Hosts Matt Miller and Hannah Elliott ahead of its release. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: The Future of Venture Capital Investing: Uncharted Summit
item.description: Michael Loeb, founder and CEO of Loeb Enterprises and host of the Uncharted summit, talks about where he sees the future of venture capital investing and gives his thoughts on how artificial intelligence is shaking up business. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Boaz Weinstein on Card Counting, Private Credit and Night Sweats
item.description: Boaz Weinstein, founder and chief investment officer of Saba Capital, spoke with Sonali Basak at a blackjack table in Atlantic City. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Ends Trade Talks With Canada
item.description: President Donald Trump said he was ending all trade discussions with Canada after claiming the country moved to implement a digital services tax, and threatened to impose a fresh tariff rate within the next week. Tyler Kendall reports from the White House. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Succinct CEO on State of Crypto Fundraising, App Development
item.description: Succinct CEO and Co-Founder Uma Roy discusses the state of crypto fundraising and app development. She speaks with Tim Stenovec and Sonali Basak on “Bloomberg Crypto.” (Source: Bloomberg)
